results.query: Analyze the relationship between Fixed Capital and Gross Value Added in Maharashtra for pharmaceutical manufacturing from 2018-19 to 2022-23 Respond in chat, not in an artifact.
results.response_text:
I'll analyze the relationship between Fixed Capital and Gross Value Added in Maharashtra's pharmaceutical manufacturing sector. Let me start by accessing the MoSPI API to get this data.

Based on your query about Fixed Capital and Gross Value Added for pharmaceutical manufacturing in Maharashtra, I need to use the ASI (Annual Survey of Industries) dataset, which contains factory-level financial data including fixed capital and GVA.

Perfect! I can see both indicators are available:

Now let me get the metadata to see what filters are available for Maharashtra and pharmaceutical manufacturing:

Great! I can see that:

Now let me fetch the Fixed Capital data first:

Excellent! Now let me fetch the Gross Value Added data:

Perfect! Now let me analyze this data for you.

Here's what the data reveals:

Fixed Capital Trends:

Gross Value Added Trends:

Key Relationship Insights:

The pharmaceutical manufacturing sector in Maharashtra shows healthy, steady capital accumulation alongside generally proportional value generation, with demonstrated capacity for exceptional performance during periods of high demand.

I'll help you analyze labor intensity in garment manufacturing across India for 2022-23 using the MoSPI API. Let me start by exploring what data is available.

The Annual Survey of Industries (ASI) dataset appears to be the right source for this data. Let me check what employment-related indicators are available.

Perfect! I found the exact indicators you need:

Now let me get the metadata to see what filter options are available for garment manufacturing in 2022-23. Since 2022-23 falls under the 2008 classification period, I'll use classification_year "2008".

Great! I can see the data is available. I found that NIC code "14" is "Manufacture of Wearing Apparel" which covers garment manufacturing. Now let me fetch the data for all three employment indicators for 2022-23.

Excellent! I've successfully retrieved the labor intensity data for garment manufacturing in India for 2022-23. Here's my assessment:

The data reveals interesting patterns about workforce composition in India's wearing apparel manufacturing sector:

Total Workforce: 1,146,509 workers

Employment Structure:

Key Insights:

This employment pattern indicates that garment manufacturing maintains traditional labor-intensive production methods with a stable workforce structure, which is crucial for both employment generation and industrial growth in India.

results.query: Evaluate production efficiency by comparing Total Output, Total Inputs, and Gross Value Added for chemical industry in West Bengal for 2020-21 Respond in chat, not in an artifact.
results.response_text:
I'll help you evaluate the production efficiency for the chemical industry in West Bengal for 2020-21. Let me fetch this data from the MoSPI API.

Now let me check the ASI dataset for the indicators related to Total Output, Total Inputs, and Gross Value Added:

Perfect! I can see the ASI dataset has exactly the indicators we need:

Now let me get the metadata to see what filters are available for 2020-21 data (which falls under classification year 2008):

Great! Now I can see the chemical industry is NIC code "20" (Manufacture of Chemicals and Chemical Products), and West Bengal has state code 19. Let me fetch the data for all three indicators:

Perfect! I have the data. Now let me provide you with a comprehensive evaluation of production efficiency for the chemical industry in West Bengal for 2020-21.

Based on data from the Annual Survey of Industries, here's the production efficiency evaluation:

Key Financial Metrics:

Efficiency Indicators:

Interpretation:

The chemical industry in West Bengal shows reasonable production efficiency with a healthy 23% value addition rate. The sector is effectively transforming inputs worth ₹21,308 crores into outputs valued at ₹27,705 crores, creating ₹6,396 crores in gross value addition. This level of value creation suggests the industry is operating with moderate efficiency, though there may be room for improvement depending on industry benchmarks and capital intensity considerations.

The 30% value addition on inputs indicates that chemical manufacturing processes in West Bengal are contributing meaningfully to the state's industrial economy, though further analysis of capital productivity, labor efficiency, and comparison with all-India averages would provide additional context for a complete efficiency assessment.

results.query: Examine the wage structure comparing Wages and Salaries, Wages and Salary of Workers, and Bonus to All Staff in steel manufacturing in Odisha for 2022-23 Respond in chat, not in an artifact.
results.response_text:
I'll help you examine the wage structure in steel manufacturing in Odisha for 2022-23. Let me start by exploring the MoSPI API to find the relevant data.

The Annual Survey of Industries (ASI) dataset is what I need for wage data in manufacturing. Let me get the available indicators.

Perfect! I found the exact indicators needed:

Now let me get the metadata to see what filters are available for Odisha and steel manufacturing for 2022-23. Since 2022-23 falls in the 2008-09 to 2023-24 range, I'll use classification_year "2008".

Great! I can see the metadata. Now I need to identify:

Let me fetch the data for all three indicators:

The 4-digit NIC code didn't return data. Let me try with the 2-digit NIC code (24 - Manufacture of Basic Metals):

Perfect! I found the data. Now let me also get the 3-digit breakdown to see if there's more specific data for steel (NIC 241 - Manufacture of Basic Iron and Steel):

Excellent! I have the specific data for steel manufacturing (Basic Iron and Steel). Here's my analysis:

I've found detailed wage data for the "Manufacture of Basic Iron and Steel" sector in Odisha for 2022-23. Here's the breakdown:

Total Wages and Salaries: ₹6,506.96 crores This is the comprehensive figure covering all employee compensation including workers, supervisory staff, and managerial employees.

Wages and Salary of Workers: ₹4,416.00 crores This represents 67.9% of total wages and salaries, showing that the bulk of compensation goes to workers (the production workforce).

Bonus to All Staff: ₹236.08 crores This represents 3.6% of total wages and salaries, covering bonuses paid to all employees.

This data shows a wage structure typical of heavy manufacturing, with the majority of compensation going to production workers while maintaining a substantial managerial and supervisory workforce.

results.query: Assess gender diversity by analyzing Total Number of Workers, No. of Directly Employed Male Workers, and No. of Directly Employed Female Workers in electronics manufacturing in Karnataka for 2022-23 Respond in chat, not in an artifact.
results.response_text:
I'll help you assess gender diversity in electronics manufacturing in Karnataka for 2022-23 using the MoSPI data. Let me start by accessing the relevant dataset.

Now let me get the indicators from the ASI (Annual Survey of Industries) dataset, which tracks employment data including gender breakdowns in manufacturing:

Perfect! I can see the ASI dataset has the exact indicators we need:

Now let me get the metadata to see what filter options are available for Karnataka and electronics manufacturing:

Excellent! I can see that NIC code "26" is "Manufacture of Computer, Electronic and Optical Products" which covers electronics manufacturing. Karnataka has state code 29, and 2022-23 data is available. Now let me fetch the data for all three indicators. Let me start with Total Number of Workers:

Perfect! I have the data for electronics manufacturing in Karnataka for 2022-23. Let me now provide you with a comprehensive gender diversity assessment based on these figures.

Based on the Annual Survey of Industries data for the Manufacture of Computer, Electronic and Optical Products (NIC code 26) in Karnataka:

Key Employment Figures:

Gender Diversity Analysis:

The directly employed workforce shows a male-to-female ratio of approximately 3.2:1, meaning for every female worker, there are about 3.2 male workers.

Breaking down the composition:

Important Note: The total number of workers (29,428) is significantly higher than the sum of directly employed male and female workers (13,115). This difference of 16,313 workers likely includes:

Gender Diversity Perspective:

While the electronics manufacturing sector in Karnataka shows female participation at nearly one-quarter of the directly employed workforce, there remains a substantial gender imbalance. The sector is still predominantly male, with women representing less than 24% of directly employed workers. This suggests significant room for improvement in gender diversity initiatives within Karnataka's electronics manufacturing industry.

results.query: Evaluate financial performance by comparing Gross Value Added, Net Value Added, Net Income, and Net Profit for pharmaceutical industry in All India for 2021-22 Respond in chat, not in an artifact.
results.response_text:
I'll help you evaluate the financial performance of the pharmaceutical industry in All India for 2021-22 by comparing these key metrics. Let me fetch this data from the MoSPI API.

Perfect! I can see that ASI has all four indicators you need:

Let me fetch the metadata for these indicators to get the filter values for the pharmaceutical industry in 2021-22.

Great! I can see the pharmaceutical industry is available. The NIC code for pharmaceuticals is "21" (Manufacture of Pharmaceuticals, Medicinal Chemical and Botanical Products). Now let me fetch all four financial metrics for 2021-22.

Perfect! Here's the financial performance evaluation for the pharmaceutical industry in All India for 2021-22:

Gross Value Added (GVA): ₹1,72,10,777 lakhs (₹172,108 crores) Net Value Added (NVA): ₹1,55,90,650 lakhs (₹155,907 crores) Net Income: ₹1,51,36,495 lakhs (₹151,365 crores) Net Profit: ₹1,02,90,717 lakhs (₹102,907 crores)

Depreciation Impact: The difference between GVA and NVA is ₹16,201 crores, representing the depreciation on fixed assets. This accounts for about 9.4% of GVA, indicating moderate capital intensity in the pharmaceutical sector.

Non-operating Items: Net Income is slightly lower than NVA by ₹4,542 crores. This gap includes items like interest paid, rent paid, and other non-operating expenses minus any interest or rent received.

Profitability: The pharmaceutical industry shows strong profitability with Net Profit at ₹102,907 crores. The Net Profit margin (Net Profit/GVA) is approximately 59.8%, which is quite healthy and reflects the high-value nature of pharmaceutical manufacturing.

Value Retention: From GVA to Net Profit, the industry retains about 60% as profit after accounting for depreciation, wages, interest, and other operating expenses. This indicates efficient operations and strong pricing power in the pharmaceutical sector.

The pharmaceutical industry demonstrates robust financial health with strong value addition and profitability in 2021-22.

results.query: Analyze comprehensive labor metrics by examining Total Number of Persons Engaged, No. of Employees Other Than Workers, Total Mandays Employed, Wages and Salaries Including Employer's Contribution, and Wages and Salaries Including Bonus for IT hardware manufacturing in Tamil Nadu for 2022-23 Respond in chat, not in an artifact.
results.response_text:
I'll help you analyze comprehensive labor metrics for IT hardware manufacturing in Tamil Nadu for 2022-23. Let me start by accessing the MoSPI API to gather this data.

Now let me check the ASI dataset for labor-related indicators:

Perfect! I found all the required indicators. Now let me get the metadata for each indicator to understand what filters are available for Tamil Nadu and IT hardware manufacturing. I'll need to use classification_year "2008" since it covers 2008-09 to 2023-24, which includes 2022-23.

Great! Now I can see NIC code 2620 is "Manufacture of Computers and Peripheral Equipment" which covers IT hardware manufacturing. Let me fetch all the required labor indicators for Tamil Nadu (state_code: 33) for 2022-23:

Let me try with 2-digit NIC code 26 (Manufacture of Computer, Electronic and Optical Products):

Perfect! I've successfully retrieved all the comprehensive labor metrics you requested. Here's the analysis for IT hardware manufacturing (Computer, Electronic and Optical Products) in Tamil Nadu for 2022-23:

Sector: Manufacture of Computer, Electronic and Optical Products (NIC 26)
State: Tamil Nadu
Period: 2022-23

1. Total Number of Persons Engaged: 114,276 This represents the entire workforce engaged in the sector, including workers and employees at all levels. Tamil Nadu shows a substantial workforce in the computer and electronics manufacturing sector.

2. No. of Employees Other Than Workers: 20,225 This represents supervisory, managerial, and administrative staff. These employees constitute approximately 17.7% of the total persons engaged, indicating a relatively high proportion of skilled professional and management positions typical of the IT hardware sector.

3. Total Mandays Employed: 34,493 thousand (34.49 million mandays) This metric captures the actual work intensity. With 114,276 persons engaged, this translates to approximately 302 mandays per person annually, suggesting relatively stable employment with some variation in working days across the workforce.

4. Wages and Salaries Including Employer's Contribution: ₹6,239.83 crores This is the total compensation including employer contributions to provident fund, pension, and other statutory benefits. This translates to approximately ₹5.46 lakhs per person annually, reflecting competitive compensation in the sector.

5. Wages and Salaries Including Bonus: ₹5,266.78 crores The difference between this and the employer's contribution figure (₹973.05 crores) represents employer statutory contributions, which accounts for about 15.6% of the total wage bill - a substantial investment in employee benefits.

The data reflects Tamil Nadu's strong position in electronics and computer hardware manufacturing, with significant employment generation and competitive compensation structures that support skilled technical and managerial talent.

results.response_text:
I'll help you get data on toy manufacturing factories in Delhi for 2025-26. Let me start by exploring the MoSPI API to find the right dataset.

The Annual Survey of Industries (ASI) dataset is the right one for factory-level data. Let me check what indicators are available for factory operations and financial metrics.

Perfect! I found all three indicators you need:

Now let me get the metadata to see what filters are available. Since 2025-26 data would fall under the 2008 classification period, I'll use that.

I can see from the metadata that:

Let me now fetch the data for all three indicators (Number of Factories, Factories in Operation, and Outstanding Loan) for toy manufacturing in Delhi for the most recent year available (2023-24).

I found the data for toy manufacturing in Delhi, though the most recent data available is for 2023-24 (not 2025-26 as requested, since ASI data for that year isn't available yet). Here's the comparison:

Toy Manufacturing in Delhi (2023-24)

Key Insights:

Note: The Annual Survey of Industries (ASI) typically has a lag of 1-2 years in data publication, so 2023-24 is the latest available year. Data for 2025-26 has not been released yet.
